GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an article object of the specified article

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
exampleResponse.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array of comment objects for a given article_id

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: adds a comment to the comments table for the article specified by the article_id parameter

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: updates the voting property of an article by adding specified amount of votes stored on inc_votes key on the request body

exampleResponse.title: Living in the shadow of a great man

GET /api/users.description: responds with an array of user objects each with a username, name, and avatar_url property

GET /api/users/:username.description: responds with a user object with keys username name and avatar_url of the user sepcified by the username parameter

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: deletes a comment specified by the comment_id parameter

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: updates the comment specified by the comment_id parameter by the amount on the inc_votes key on the request body. Responds with the updated object

exampleResponse.body: Oh, I've got compassion running out of my nose, pal! I'm the Sultan of Sentiment!

POST /api/articles.description: posts a new article and responds with the article object that would be in the database (article_img_url is potional and has a default)

POST /api/topics.description: post a new topic to the database (description is optional)

DELETE /api/articles/:article_id.description: deletes the article and corresponding comments of the article specified by the article_id parameter
